reviewText: My 12-yr daughter and I moved right into Season 2 as soon as we finished Season 1.We noticed a few things right away.1) The screen width was cut down from widescreen to a traditional TV 3:4 ratio picture.2) The claymation animators made changes to the appearance of some of the characters. These include the Farmer who now has a perpetual 5 o-clock shadow, Blitzer the dog who now has hair-like details rather than the simpler more innocent smooth finish you would be used to seeing on Gromit (if you know Wallace and Gromit) and more detail around the mouth and nose.  The cat has been upgraded from a sort of wolverine/bear like critter to a cat with claws, and it plays a bigger role in season 2 than in season 1.  While a few of these changes were probably a good idea, I think that changes to the characters' appearances were more distracting than beneficial.  Like I mentioned before, these changes made the characters less innocent looking and, well, I missed most of the old versions.3) One of the things that totally cracked me up about Season 1 was the way that Blitzer blows his whistle and occasionally hands out yellow or red cards, just like a soccer (football) referee.  Sadly, he doesn't do that any more.  I REALLY miss that.Anyway, changes aside, the series is still worth a look, especially if you still have children around the house.  Oh, and I still love the pigs.  They and the sheet still mix things up from time to time - hilarious!The animation is still fun and fresh, and changes aside, it's still a solid 4-star offering (considering Wallace and Gromit in their three original adventures as being 5 stars).If you like Wallace and Gromit or Shaun the Sheep Season 1, you will almost certainly like Season 2 as well.Keep up the good work!
Title: Shaun the Sheep - Complete Series 2 anglais

reviewText: The first season of Shaun the Sheep is brilliant: simple stories, a genuine wit and charm and an innocence in the plots and characters.  None of them have ill intentions, except for the pigs who are the antagonists.  I am and always will be a huge fan of season one.Season two, however, is a stark change from season one and the humor has changed from simple wit and charm to offensive humor.  The nature of the characters have changed as well, as now it is not simply Shaun trying to have fun, coming up with a plan, and then shenanigans ensuing.  The second season makes every character to be a manipulative opportunist, including the dog, each of the sheep including Shaun, and even the cat.  If I wanted to watch television with a bunch of jerks I'd just watch regular television.In the second season I saw Shaun flip the bird (as in his middle finger,) the flock sabotage each other, and the farmer try to make a buck off of some ducks on his farm.  The first season showed the flock to be united, the farmer was not THAT opportunistic, and there were definitely no middle fingers.  In the first season it shows that everyone listens to Shaun and likes and respects him, whereas in season two the flock and the dog at one point are laughing at him and gesturing that he's crazy.It is a sad change and the show lost all of its heart in Season 2.
summary: Huge Fan of Season One, Not a Fan of Season Two

reviewText: This is a very clever series.  No actual dialog -- hey, they're animals, right?  Well, sort of.  The sheep, pigs, ducks, dog and Farmer get in all sorts of pickles and -- I find this the best aspect of these skits -- work together to fix what's wrong.There is no meanness in these skits.  The "lesson" for the watcher is one of using cooperation to get things done.The visual appeal is great because the characters are not computer generated (a perfectly fine method) but stop motion -- each real piece is posed and recorded one frame at a time, then moved, recorded, moved, etc.Each character has its own distinct personality.  Shaun is the star -- a cute friend to all.
Title: Shaun the Sheep - Complete Series 2 anglais

reviewText: I'm not sure why I'm surprised that I enjoyed this show, as I'm actually a fan of Wallace & Grommit and also Chicken Run, but for whatever reason I had put off watching this series. I was scouring for the least annoying possibilities to view with my young daughter and finally succumbed to put this on. I regret absolutely nothing, except perhaps waiting for so long. There is no dialog, just grunts, groans and baas, and the plots are short and simple, yet easy to watch and follow along. Bravo to the animators for giving us yet another lovable series that doesn't insult the intelligence of youth, but simply tells a fun and endearing story.

reviewText: a new collection of Shaun the Sheep  Tales is always reason to cheer.  i have been waiting for this new collection for quite some time. the new episodes  have been released on DVD piece meal, seven tales at a time under various DVD titles, but no complete collection, then  i recently found these all season two episodes on my NetFlix  Video Streaming Service.  i then checked Amazon and found the Second Season was being offered as a PRE ORDER with a due date of November 15.  i did a bit of research and discovered that the set consisted of  forty episodes.  i placed my pre order without hesitation.i am not going to go over each of the forty episodes, as time and space would not permit it.  suffice it to say, the tales are great fun  to watch.  i've watched some with one of my grand daughters (age 11) and the enjoyment she she displayed  will warm the heart of any grandparent.  all the episodes are worthwhile and be sure to notice all the attention to detail that is diplayed.  the hard work that goes into making these small inanimate creatures move and act as if they're actually alive is impossible to comprehend. Shaun the Sheep, his flock, Bitzer the dog, The Farmer and all the other "actors" are truly works of genius by the tatented people who bring them to life.  you cannot go wrong in purchasing this Second Season Collection.  i only hope that these characters will  continue to be brought to life by this band of creators inm future episodes and collections.there is one small item i do take issue with.  the characters of Bitzer and The Farmer, as wsell as several others have their appearance changed from the way they were originally presented.  i prefer the original way over the current appearence.  it isn't a major issue however.
Title: Shaun the Sheep - Complete Series 2 anglais

reviewText: We LOVE Shaun the Sheep.  This DVD contains 40 episodes (each about 7 minutes long) from season 2 of the British series.  These are appropriate and enjoyable for all ages (big giggles from 3 to adult).  Everyone in our family enjoys this series.  The plots center around the adventures of Shaun and his flock of sheep.  They live on a farm with a well-meaning but somewhat clueless farmer.  The sheep battle their rivals, the cat and the wily pigs with the help of the sheep dog, Bixby.  In these shorts, there are no words, this is pure pantomime.  Highly recommend!

reviewText: Shaun remains his lively self, and his doggie friend Bitzer is more charming than ever.  My favorite episode has Bitzer cooking up an elaborate meal for the farmer and his beautiful lady-friend.  Of course the shy farmer's ego and romantic prospects are on the line, so naturally he'd want to put his trusted dog in charge of the cooking. Wouldn't you?  Bitzer wears his heart on his sleeve and does his best, but wouldn't you know it ... things go wrong!  Oh no!  It's all very lovely and cute as the dickens.This show is a pure winner.  Every character is charming, even the not-very-villainous villains, and the problems, snafus, and oopses come about and get resolved in an upbeat way.  The claymation is visually charming and very inventive; it's always a treat to see what unlikely thing they've managed to animate, and fun to try to imagine how they could possibly have done it.It is more oriented toward a child's level of attention than Nick Park's other hugely popular claymation winner, Wallace & Grommit, but would not be at all hard for an adult to sit through with his child.  Heck, I often can't stop at one and wind up watching a second or even third.  The episodes are pretty re-watchable, too.  Highly recommended, especially for kids and lovers of state-of-the-art claymation.
Title: Shaun the Sheep - Complete Series 2 anglais

reviewText: This is a great DVD set. There are TONS/TONNES of great episodes (40!!!) and lotsa bonus bits on the two DVDs, so it'll take you several nights of viewing to get through this entire Season 2 compilation. Here's what you get:Double TroubleDraw The LineSheepless NightsSpring LambStrictly No DancingWho's The Caddy?Hair Today, Gone TomorrowBagpipe BuddySupersize TimmyLock OutCheetah CheaterEwe've Been FramedBitzer's New HatHide & SqueakFrantic RomanticEverything Must GoParty AnimalsCat Got Your Brain?In The DoghouseTwo's CompanyThe BoatWhat's Up Dog?Cock-a-Doodle ShaunBitzer's Basic TrainingChip Off The Old BlockPig TroubleBitzer From The Black LagoonZebra Ducks...Whistle BlowerThe Big ChaseThe MagpieOperation PidsleyPig Swill FlyShirley WhirleyFoxy LaddieShaun Goes PottyAn Ill WindFireside FavoriteSnowed InWe Wish Ewe a Merry ChristmasAll that, plus two games, four video shorts (+ a "making of" short), a behind the scenes gallery, and the usual trailers. Whew! Most of the episodes are good-to-great, but be prepared for a change in tone and appearance from that of Season 1. I won't give spoilers here, but the "changes" were NOT all that off-putting, IMHO. So... it's ALL here in this DVD. Check my list of contents BEFORE buying other DVDs. You'll save money and avoid disappointment.
summary: A comprehensive collection! Buy this first!

Title: Shaun the Sheep - Complete Series 2 anglais

reviewText: We have enjoyed this program for a long time now.  We discovered it through our Netflix account, and usually watch each week during family get-togethers.  Unfortunately, Netflix quit carrying it, but thankfully....we found it on Amazon!  Yea!  = }
Title: Shaun the Sheep - Complete Series 2 anglais

reviewText: Watching Shaun the Sheep or Wallace and Gromit is a terrific way to relax and unwind with some great laughs.  I am always totally amazed that this is claymation; the skill and artistry of these productions is incredible.  I also happen to be delighted by the British architecture and style.  Great stuff!  Sit back, relax, and enjoy.
Title: Shaun the Sheep - Complete Series 2 anglais

reviewText: You go Shaun!  You rock. Great animating for the whole family.  Provides amusement plus simple lessons for children.  I highly recommend this series.
Title: Shaun the Sheep - Complete Series 2 anglais

Title: Shaun the Sheep - Complete Series 2 anglais

reviewText: They changed the farmer's face.  Why?They changed Blitzer's fur.  Why?The poop in the field is gone.  Why?It seems a little more contrived this time.The sheep are more purposefully mischievous, sometimes purposefully destructive, and a little raunchier than last season.  Keep it clean, guys.  My two year, five year, and seven year olds want to watch it with me!
Title: Shaun the Sheep - Complete Series 2 anglais

reviewText: A great show to watch young or old fun.  Great detail in the sets sound and lighting its amazing. Watch and enjoy.
Title: Shaun the Sheep - Complete Series 2 anglais

reviewText: This remains one of the most brilliantly imagined and crafted animated series we've ever seen.  Perfect for grade-school kids and adults. If you don't laugh watching these episodes, some evil doctor removed your funny bone while you slept.
summary: Running the modern farm, as explained by a sheep
Title: Shaun the Sheep - Complete Series 2 anglais

reviewText: Another great season with loads of creativity and laughter.  Only one episode with few laughs, the rest were so great!
summary: We love Shaun and Timmy and the gang!

reviewText: Can not wait for some more to come out. My grandson just loves them. The fixes they get in and out of are just outstanding.
